oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ecologically relevant biomarkers reveal that chronic effects of nitrate depend on sex and life stage in the invasive fish Gambusia holbrooki
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cano-Rocabayera, Oriol
Sostoa, Adolfo
Padrós, Francesc
Cárdenas, Lorena
Maceda-Veiga, Alberto
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: biomarker
aquatic invasion
Eastern mosquitofish
invasive species
invasive fish
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Agricultural intensification and shifts in precipitation regimes due to global climate change are expected to increase nutrient concentrations in aquatic ecosystems. However, the direct effects of nutrients widely present in wastewaters, such as nitrate, are poorly studied. Here, we use multiple indicators of fish health to experimentally test the effects of three ecologically relevant nitrate concentrations (
